name: Marilyn's Final Days Online Trivia | Marilyn Monroe | 10 Questions

questions.text: Marilyn never completed her last film: she was fired. This film was ____________ ?
questions.explanation:
Something's Gotta Give.

	It was a light comedy - but she was often absent and falling apart.

questions.text: The last picture that she actually completed was 'The Misfits', written by Arthur Miller. Which actor was NOT in this movie?
questions.explanation:
Dean Martin.

	Dean was the star of the movie that was never completed. (See preceding question)This was also Gable's last film - he died a short while after it was finished.

questions.text: It is generally accepted by most historians that Marilyn was romantically involved at one time or another with all of the following EXCEPT ________ ?
questions.explanation:
Ted Kennedy.

	Joe was a husband at one time, of course. The affairs with JFK and RFK were problems for all concerned.

questions.text: During the days before her death, Marilyn spent time at a resort on the California Nevada border (appropriately called Cal-Neva). A principal owner of the resort was _________ ?
Marilyn threatened to 'blow the lid off things' shortly before her death - in apparent retaliation for her treatment by the Kennedys. Of particular concern was the fact that Marilyn was:
options: Conversing with journalists about her life story
questions.explanation:
Keeping a diary.

	Marilyn's diary apparently included a lot of 'hot' information that she had learned from the Kennedys. It vanished after her death.

Eunice Murray.

	Eunice gave a lot of interesting - and conflicting - versions of what happened before she passed away.

Ralph Greenson.

	As with Murray, Greenson knew more than he was telling.

questions.text: The problem with the theory of her death as an accident or suicide is ________ ?
options: There was no glass present from which to drink water
The timeline of events didn't make sense
The autopsy findings raised some serious questions
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	Very, very suspicious.
